description:
Provides a resource to configure lb service on NSX-T manager.
Note that lb service needs to be attached to Tier-1 router that satisfies
following preconditions:
* It needs to reside on edge cluster
* It needs to be condigured with either uplink port or centralized service port

In order to enforce correct order of create/delete, it is recommended to add
depends_on clause to lb service.

~> **NOTE:** This resource requires NSX version 2.3 or higher.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

DisplayName.description: The display name of this resource. Defaults to ID if not set.

Enabled.description: whether the load balancer service is enabled.

ErrorLogLevel.description: Load balancer engine writes information about encountered issues of different severity levels to the error log. This setting is used to define the severity level of the error log.

LogicalRouterId.description: Tier1 logical router this service is attached to. Note that this router needs to have edge cluster configured, and have an uplink port or CSP (centralized service port).

Size.description: Size of load balancer service. Accepted values are SMALL/MEDIUM/LARGE.

VirtualServerIds.description: Virtual servers associated with this Load Balancer.
